titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James N. Carty Papers 1881-1918
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Darcie Hart Riedner

publicationstmt.publisher: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-12-10T11:09-0800

repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections

did.abstract: This collection consists of account books and ledgers of two generations of the Carty family farm near Ridgefield, Washington.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

acqinfo.p: This collection was donated to the Washington State University Libraries by James E. Carty in 1977.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of account books and ledgers of the Carty farm near Ridgefield, Washington. The papers, from 1881-1918, detail livestock purchases, wages, butter sales, rental equipment and stock agreements, calf sales and other income and expenses of James N. Carty and his son, William E. Carty. A genealogy of the Carty family is also included with these papers.

arrangement.p: This collection is organized in two series.

prefercite.p: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections Washington State University Libraries Pullman, WA
